page.title: 02Occupations
page.content:
The village of Berwick St.James has an adult population of 149 people representing 71 family groups.
Whereas, in the past,before travelling to work became so widely acceptable,the village must have been almost totally dependent on the farming industry, now only 18 of those families are in any way connected with farming.
22 of the families are ones where the adults have retired from work.
The remainder,apart from the owners of the shop and the managers of the pub, commute to work, some to nearby Forces' establishments. At present, 3 families have someone who is unemployed.
